description.narrative: In September 2009, the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) signed a five-year, $540 million compact with the Republic of Senegal designed to reduce poverty and invest in economic growth by unlocking the country's agricultural productivity and expanding access to markets and services. This goal will be achieved through the rehabilitation of major national roads and strategic investments in irrigation and water resource management infrastructure. The Government of Senegal has identified two national-level strategies: to reduce poverty in Senegal through economic growth and to increase the country's food security. Both of these priorities will be facilitated through MCC's $540 million compact. For the most up-to-date information on implementation progress, please read the Quarterly Status Report.

title.narrative: Senegal Compact Monitoring and Evaluation Plan
Senegal Post-Compact Monitoring and Evaluation Plan
Improving Irrigation Systems and Land Tenure Security in Senegal

condition.narrative: 1) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived).
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Conditions Precedent Report

2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Copies of any reports received from any technical (including, without limitation, environmental) auditors engaged by MCA-Senegal for any Project or Activity since the pervious Disbursement Request
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Detailed Financial Plan
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Disbursement Request
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Indicator Tracking Table
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: MCA Disbursement Certificate
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Narrative Report
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Procurement Performance Report
2) MCA-Senegal has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC: Quarterly Financial Report

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: Activities to be funded with MCC Funding being requested by such Disbursement Request will not violate any applicable law or regulation

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: All applicable conditions precedent in Schedule 2 to the PIA have been duly satisfied, deferred, or waived as provided in the PIA

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: Any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date ninety (90) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8 of the Compact

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: Any payment obligation of the Government arising through the date thirty (30) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period has been paid in full (or otherwise satisfied) by the Government, including, without limitation, any insurance, indemnification, tax payments, or other obligations, and the Government has contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, the PIA, and any Supplemental Agreement

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: Each of the Officers remains engaged, or if a position is vacant, MCA-Senegal is actively engaged, to MCC's satisfaction, in recruiting a replacement

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: No material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Senegal, or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the PIA, the Compact, or any Supplemental Agreement

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: The Implementation Plan Documents submitted to MCC are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been satisfactory progress on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects, Activities or sub-Activities related to such Disbursement

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: There has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require)

3) MCA-Senegal has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA: There has been satisfactory progress on the M&E Plan for the Program, any relevant Project, or any relevant Activity, and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period)

4) Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, funding for a specific Project and/or Activity, MCA-Senegal shall have duly executed an Implementing Entity Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, with the applicable Implementing Entity involved in the implementation of such Project and/or Activity, and such Implementing Entity Agreement shall be in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission, or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default shall have occurred or be continuing thereunder.

5) Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, payment under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project and/or Activity (or any component or segment thereof, as the case may be) (and, with respect to sub-clause (ii) hereof, prior to each such Disbursement thereafter), MCA-Senegal shall have submitted evidence satisfactory to MCC demonstrating that an environmental review has been completed in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be), which environmental review may include, without limitation, an SEA, EIA, EA, EMP, HIV/AIDS awareness plan, and/or RAP (collectively, the "Applicable ESA Documentation") and (ii) MCA-Senegal, or the appropriate Government entity, is in compliance with the requirements of the Applicable ESA Documentation with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be) in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines.

7) Prior to any disbursement of MCC Funding in or for Year 5 of the Compact Term, the Government shall have presented a plan pursuant to which it will assume all of the contractual, financial, and other obligations of MCA-Senegal upon expiration of the Compact Term, including, but not limited to, any severance payments owed to MCA-Senegal's employees upon the termination or expiration of their respective employment contracts
